title: Calcaneus 2017 Ginestra Bianco  (Etna)
description: Subtle scents of Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit slowly take shape. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts mature yellow apple and lemon zest, while a salty note marks the close.

title: Casca Wines 2013 Monte Cascas Altitude Sparkling (Távora-Varosa)
description: This lightly spicy and definitely perfumed wine comes from high-altitude vines planted in an area just south of the Douro and known for its sparkling wines. It is so crisp, bright and fruity with delicious acidity and a fine sweep of freshness at the end. Drink now.

title: Ceste 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of baking spice, tilled soil and ripe dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, clove and tobacco alongside chewy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2016 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Steely lime, fresh apple and white flower aromas start off this semidry offering. A juicy orchard fruit flavor starts off the palate, with astringent green pear rind and lime coming in midway. The finish is brisk and clean.

title: Château Moncontour 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Lightly honeyed and with white fruits, almonds and a touch of minerality, this wine is already delicious. Its freshness and crisp texture are both young and the wine will age. Drink at its best from 2020.

title: Château Tanunda 2015 100 Year Old Vines Shiraz (Barossa)
description: Notes of plush berry fruit, vanilla and cherry cola are followed by a palate that feels a little hot from the alcohol and is almost syrupy in texture, with grainy tannins and prominent oak throughout. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Collier Creek 2017 Crafty Fox Merlot (Lodi)
description: Red cherry aromas and a creamy texture highlight this medium-bodied, well-priced and certified sustainable wine. It has good concentration to keep your interest and very smooth tannins for easy drinking.

title: D. Massin NV Cuvée de Réserve Brut  (Champagne)
description: A blend of 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay, this is a rich wine. Ripe apple flavors are up front, with gentle acidity to balance. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Dante Robere 2015 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Strong woody aromas like cedar, oak and wood smoke are carried through in the flavors of this big and firmly tannic wine. Oak and baking-spice notes dominate the taste while the full body fills the mouth and releases blueberry and blackberry on the finish.

title: Domaine de Bel Air 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: A smoothly textured wine, this is soft and full of ripe white fruits. Its acidity and grassy character are controlled by the wine's richness. Balanced and finishing with crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de la Pinsonnière NV Brut  (Vouvray)
description: This honey- and apple-flavored wine is deliciously fresh. With a hint of almonds as well as the fruit, it is perfumed and ready to drink.

title: Domaine du Vieux Bourg NV Jean-Marie et Noël Girard Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: An attractive blend of Cabernet Franc and Chenin Blanc, this wine is fruity, with touches of almonds. It is perfumed, rounded and softly textured, showing flavors of ripe apples as well as crisper citrus. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gibault 2016 Emotion Red (Touraine)
description: This is a rich blend of Malbec (known locally as Cot) and Cabernet France. It has a dense, ripe black-fruit-flavored character that is concentrated and just maturing. A touch of spice goes with the blackberry flavors that finish with good acidity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Paul Thomas 2017 Chavignol Rosé (Sancerre)
description: Ripe red fruits are cut with acidity smoothed by a touch of caramel in this balanced wine. It is fresh while also rich, taut and fruity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2017 Les Godons  (Sancerre)
description: This bottling shows a full, fat style of Sauvignon Blanc, although the wine hasn't lost all its freshness and has kept some citrus flavors. Its richness reflects the warm vintage, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink from 2019.

title: Draxton 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Polished and generous tannins wrap around elusive fruit and more up-front notions of clove and forest in this older vintage wine. Underlying succulence saves it from tasting too broadly flat or undefined.

title: Draxton 2017 Rosé of Pinot Meunier (Napa Valley)
description: Tasting like a cherry-orange Creamsicle, this wine from an unusual variety is pleasing in freshness and lighthearted body weight, an easygoing quaff that many will enjoy.

title: Enrico Serafino 2015  Barbaresco
description: Subdued aromas of dark fruit, coconut and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers black plum, mocha and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2020.

title: Flanagan 2014 The Beauty of Three Red (Bennett Valley)
description: A proprietary blending of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon with 15% Syrah and 5% Merlot, this is a big-boned, considerably ripe expression of blackberry, black currant and soy with a soft rounded structure and finish of cocoa powder.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: There are plenty of cailloux (stones) in Pouilly Fumé and this wine shows the steel and minerality that results from this soil. Very crisp while also with a richer element, this wine needs to age further. Drink from 2019.
